head.title: Redact {{EXT}} Documents using Regular Expressions via .NET Core
head.description: Redact out sensitive information using regular expression from documents of different formats

header.title: Sanitize {{EXT}} Files via {{ProgLang}} and Regular Expressions in .NET Core Apps
header.description: Find and remove sensitive information from Office & OpenOffice Documents, Spreadsheets & Presentations as well as {{EXT}} on Windows, Linux & macOS

about.title: Document Text Redaction for .NET API
about.h1: A single format-independent interface for sanitization of sensitive and classified information from the PDF, Word, Excel, PowerPoint documents and images, including the ability to change metadata and remove comments. With {{ProductFullName}} tool you can redact out the classified information and save redacted document in PDF, transforming all pages into raster images or keep the document in its original format for further editing.

steps.title_left: Redact Text from {{EXT}} using Regular Expressions via {{ProgLang}}

content_left.description: [GroupDocs.Redaction]({{slash_lang}}/redaction/{{ProductCode}}/) allows {{ProductName}} developers to use full strength of regular expressions to redact {{EXT}} file with a few easy steps.
content_left.step_1: Create an instance of [Redactor](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/groupdocs.redaction/redactor) class & load {{EXT}} file
content_left.step_2: Create an instance of [RegexRedaction](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/groupdocs.redaction.redactions/regexredaction) class to find and replace the text
content_left.step_3: Call [Redactor.Apply](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/net/groupdocs.redaction/redactor/methods/apply/index) method with object of RegexRedaction

content_right.description: {{ProductFullName}} APIs are supported on all major platforms and operating systems. Before executing the code below, please make sure that you have the following prerequisites installed on your system.
content_right.step_1: Install from command line as ```nuget install GroupDocs.Redaction``` or via Package Manager Console of Visual Studio with ```Install-Package GroupDocs.Redaction```.
content_right.step_2: Alternatively, get the offline MSI installer or DLLs in a ZIP file from [downloads](https://downloads.groupdocs.com/redaction/net), and reference it in your project manually.
